before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"brsed","text":"It is important to annotate the location of the source plate in the OT-2 slots, the identity of the samples is provided by excel sheets in the input variable and if 2 samples, within a plate or between different source plates has the same name, they will be indistinguishable in the final plate (s)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"bvca","text":"This protocol is meant to transfer samples from different plates to a single or fewer final plates than the source number, in other words, merge samples of different source plates in a final plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"909fc","text":"The output of running this script will be the final plate(s) with samples and a reactive (optional), and the corresponding map(s) with the original identities of the samples which will be given by the user in the input file.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4v338","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"265a3","text":"This protocol uses a python script for an Opentrons 2 robot and an excel file containing the required variables to set the number of samples, volumes of transfer, type of plates, etc... ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2s9b8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c8hdm","text":"In our laboratory, this protocol has been used as part of the \"High-throughput workflow for the genotypic characterization of transposon library variants\" also available in protocols.io","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"evqc2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ao79c","text":"This protocol is a set of instructions or description of the LAP repository entry LAP-NplateMerging-OT2-1.0.0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":82,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":61,"length":14}],"data":{}},{"key":"9bruf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5mi6o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"42989504FF9447C9B1B2CCC1C796D3C6","url":"http://www.laprepo.com"}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"4plq8","text":"This protocol was developed with python 3.7.1, OT App Software Version 6.3.1 and API level version 2.14 in a Linux 4.14.74 system (these are the OT-2 specifications).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"46d70","text":"In the script several packages are used:  pandas (0.25.3), openpyxl (3.1.2), math, random and numpy (1.15.1)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eion9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ce1m0","text":"It has been tested with cultures from Pseudomonas putida KT2440 as part of the High-throughput workflow for the genotypic characterization of transposon library variants.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":38,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42qhp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b9d91","text":"The maximum number of 96-well plates per run is 8 source plates to 1 final plates dispensing some media (need of 1 falcon tube rack), 1 pipette is required for all the volumes and the replace of tip racks is allowed (set as True in the input variable file)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
